description:
Excellent chai! I tried their golden latte-- it was nicely steamed and had a spicy kick. The turmeric powder DOES settle so I would recommend not taking the last sip in the cup. Price wise, it cost me a over $5 with tax for the smaller size. In general prices here are on the higher side.

The cafe has a nice modern industrial feel. There is one big tall communal table in the center of the cafe, with some high top tables along the windows and two seater tables against the walls. It looks like a decent place to work. There is a self serve water area and a co-ed bathroom (that needs a code to enter).
author: Jennifer C.

description:
At 4.50$ for a small coffee you better be working at Twitter or square to pay for the coffee. Who am I kidding... everything in the city is overpriced 

Decent coffee 3.5/5
Good space to sit 4/5
Wish they had small bites or savory offerings as well
author: Vikas J.

description:
Conveniently located a skip away from my core40 studio in SOMA, this Contraband location is quite the opposite of the more smaller Nob Hill one. I love the high ceilings, modern art and solid wood tables. The service is friendlier too.

I got my usual Pirates spicy chai ($4.75) latte. It was perfectly frothed up, but didn't have the usual latte art that I get from NH location. Treats from Neighbor Bakehouse are available if you're hungry and wifi is strong for you laptop campers.
author: Janice C.

description:
Sadly wasn't too crazy about this spot. The coffee is good but they only serve pour-overs and they're expensive, which normally wouldn't be a big deal for me, but it's a machine who does it for you so the premium you're paying for a pour over feels wasted. Also there are a few coffees on the menu I wanted to try but you can only buy the beans for, which was frustrating to say the least...

Also the design and furniture is super sleek, but actually not that comfortable for lounging, even though there is plenty of seating.
author: Jason S.

description:
Stopped by here to grab a few coffees, teas and pastries and was pretty happy with the experience.

Very modern, minimal place (besides the branding, awful awful branding) with experienced staff and what looks to be very well maintained equipment.

The espressos were very good, as was the jasmine tea. Really delicious pistachio croissant as well.

Nothing crazy here but solid stuff.
author: Nova W.

description:
Cool little coffee shop which was pretty lonely and empty for 7am on a Thursday, haha,
I got the latte with rosemary & sage latte ($5.50) which was pretty yummy. Cool custom built wooden tables/counters!
author: Michael K.

description: I enjoyed their espresso drinks (cortado, macchiatto) twice during the conference at Moscone Center.  It is on expensive side, but coffee and atmosphere (SOMA) are pretty good.  Location is also convenient.
author: Alex G.

description:
Why 3 stars? Because I didn't dig the bean here.

   ---   ---   ---

I headed over here for a quick double-shot of espresso before my morning workout. Usually when that's all I order at a coffee shop, I don't have many details to provide in a review. For the most part, a double shot of espresso is pretty much the same no matter where you go.

But in this case, I ordered the Illicit Espresso, and I have to say that I really disliked the beans. I'm not sure if the illicit always uses the same ones, but if so, I'd seriously recommend that they switch them up. The taste was pretty jarring - I only forced it down due to the necessity for my pre-workout caffeine. 

I did enjoy the music while I sipped my not-so-tasty espresso and water. I asked the girl behind the counter and she said it was XXX Tentacion (RIP.) The music was definitely my favorite part of this experience.
author: Brett N.

description:
Contraband already had a bustling, compact venue on the Polk corridor prior to this airy, sparkling new venue in SoMa. Here, you'll get the same decent coffee, including pour-over options, with a little more space to spread out. 

This having been said, however, there's a nice-looking but space-hogging communal table in the middle of the establishment that I wonder might be better put to use as a series of small tables for 2. While the space is big and boxy, somehow it doesn't seem like it's arranged for as many people as it could actually fit. 

Still, this is nitpicking; the coffee is pretty good here and the space is an extra.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Coffee too expensive and too pretentious to spend my money here unless I absolutely need a cup of joe.

I remember when they first opened up and they were like a French press only spot, but they've looked up.

Some people love this place, but I'm pretty sure they are high.

Ain't nothin different dude, it's coffee. The only thing that makes me go "wow" is probably something at Philz, this ain't it.
author: John W.

description:
I was looking for some coffee to grab & go first thing in the morning, checked the Yelp app and was immediately befuddled. Too. Many. Options. What? Not used to that. I also needed to get my bearings as I had checked into the Intercontinental the previous night and didn't go out afterwards. I'm directionally challenged. In San Francisco, I've lost count of how many times I've gotten lost and wasted the better part of an hour trying figure out where I'm going. Needed. Coffee. Immediately.

I asked the concierge to point me in the right direction of Contraband. When I walked in, I immediately regretted not bringing my laptop! There's plenty of seating. It's a chill little spot and something about it is conducive to working. Regrets. I have a few.

But drinking the coffee here is not one of them. They are coffee experts! They care about your drinking experience. One unique thing that I appreciate about their menu is they vary the level of intensity with espresso pulls and Americanos. They suggest water or soda water backs. My head was spinning with choices. Happy times.

Baristas are approachable and fast. I went in a little after typical rush hour, around 10, and was served quickly. I had a double Americano, which was pretty dang perfect, if a little more acidic tasting than I typically prefer (I like a strong smoky, roasted flavor). Not to take away anything from their craft. I wish I could report on their cold brew. Next time!
author: Joi B.

description:
A quick easy cup of coffee and at least some free wifi. Prices are a little higher than average with a Cortado coming in at above $4, but as a working cafe - Contraband looked comfortable. All shots pulled are double shots. The cortado was super smooth and I am pretty sure they used whole milk.

The reclaimed wooden tables that made up the cafe made for a nice ambiance and it's a quick walk from some of the hotels nearby (such as the Intercontinental).
author: Alex L.

description:
Went to Contraband before a Giants games. Honestly I lowered my expectations because it seems like the coffee craft has depleted over the years across the board at most coffee places. It was a pleasant surprise that I left Contraband completely satisfied. 

Cleanliness (4/5): didn't really look too closely at cleanliness but overall everything looked organized and clean. The bathroom was also clean! 

Customer experience (3/5): not bad, not great. The barista/cashier seemed friendly but there wasn't much chatter between the three of us - kind of awkward silence as we decided what to order. A higher rating would require a conversation - i.e. offering suggestions or asking us if we've been here before. 

Product/service quality (5/5): My friend ordered a cold brew and I decided to try the sage and rosemary latte. I didn't try the cold brew but my friend said it was one of the best she's had - most times cold brew turns out to be underwhelming with lack of depth in flavor and body. The barista did warn me the latte would be sweet and in fact it was. But it wasn't the taste of syrup sweetness - most of a savory sweet taste. The foam was also properly aerated-velvety and sweet.
author: Martin N.

description:
This place is on the $$ for coffee. $4.25/$4.50 for a cup of drip coffee; $5-6 for a latte -- not including soy or almond milk yet.

The mochi muffins were on point and inspired me to make them because they're so yummy. They're produced by a local bakery.

Ambiance: I came too early for a lunch date, so had 1.5 hours to kill. Found Contraband and chilled. Left for lunch and came back afterward with my same cup of coffee. The workers didn't say anything or bother me, which was the perfect solution for my day.

Pro tip: This place is open until 8pm, so used it as my office most of the day until I went to a networking event.
author: Christina L.

description: The coffee was good, but it was pricey for what it was. The coffee shop is a nice, clean looking space, but it was not homey. People set up shop there to work on their laptops, so no one was talking to each other. (If you are looking for that quiet kind of place, this is a good one! It's small though, so you would have to get there before the other people do.) The vibe felt too cold to have a conversation with my friend, so we took our coffee outside and walked around instead.
author: Kamille V.

description:
Two of my favorite things: Bhakti chai and Hawaiian mochi muffins. Both at Contraband. Kind of miraculous. 

The vibe here is great, spacious, tons of light and good music. I don't love paying $6 for my dirty chai but I can justify it as a once in a while treat.

An excellent choice if you're looking for a SOMA cafe with character. Good for working solo, or work meetings. Not overly crowded, as it's nicely off the beaten path.
author: Nique F.

description:
This coffee shop has a lot of things that I really like. From the pastries to the layout of the coffee shop, it's just an ideal place to spend the afternoon. Really open and bright atmosphere, with its floor to ceiling windows.

I only got to try their Hawaiian mochi muffin, and it was really tasty. I expected there to be mochi bits in it, but it's actually... just a mochi consistency throughout? The muffin was soft and moist and pulled apart nicely. It was a nice afternoon snack, and it's also not too sweet! 

They have a decent amount of seating and really good wifi. Good for working, and I saw a bunch of teams host meetings there. Hopefully I can come back again to try more of their pastries and drinks!
author: Priscilla S.

description: Much smaller than it looks in photos. Coffee is way overpriced, even for SF, but I did enjoy the rosemary flavored iced latte. It's actually not a great place to work - they have very loud Top 40 music playing constantly, and it's not air conditioned, which can be hot on a sunny day.
author: Emily S.

description:
I loved Contraband Coffee Bar but won't go there anymore.

Because I had my laptop stolen by a robber! A man appeared from behind grabed my laptop and ran.

I DO NOT RECCOMEND TO WORK THERE.

Contraband has outlets and wifi that is handy but there isn't secure. Everyone can look over the entire inside and enter easily.

You can see a lot of people work with their laptop at the cafe from outside. It seems nomad-workers-friendly but a robber aims them. Be careful.
author: Namika H.

description: Coffee tastes like dirty water. $5.50 for a quad americano and it was so watered down, I could almost see the bottom of my cup. No crema whatsoever.
author: Serge H.

description:
Holy coffee cow!  If you want to take an up close & personal look at the Maserati of coffee equipment, this is the place.

Gorgeous wood tables & window seating.  2 entire walls of windows.  High ceiling.  Light & airy freshness.  The feel is positive, & decidedly not cavernous like their Russian Hill location.

The barista was uber knowledgeable, uber friendly, & straight up delightful.  

Be sure to try the Hawaiian mochi.  Availability is very limited, & they always sell out.  They're baked by a dedicated artisan in the east bay who actually gets key ingredients from Hawaiian stateside.

Yet another reason that we can actually appreciate the East Bay for.

Quality coffee, outstanding pastries, beautiful space, & great service.  SOMA needed this.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I got the iced sage rosemary latte, half sweet - highly recommend! I prefer a cold brew over anything usually but if you want a bit of jazz to your drink go for this one

I love getting work done here on my wfh days. Awesome vibe and super friendly staff. In the smack right middle of the buzz so lots of people walking around and a nice chance to "people watch" lol! And also lots of outlets and fast wifi, tho you do get booted after a couple hours.
author: Swan K.

description: This is a solid coffee shop to do work. Reliable wifi, nice open space with lots of natural lighting. It can get pretty busy and loud at times, especially during coffee run rushes, but that's to be expected at coffee shops. I tried the golden chai latte, which was pretty good, but maybe a little too savory/rich for me. I liked my friend's sage and rosemary latte better, so I would suggest getting that instead. I came in on a early Thursday afternoon and they were already out of their mochi muffins, but I would love to come back in the morning and try one of those too.
author: Shannon C.

description: The coffee is good and the baristas are personable and skilled. My only criticism is the inside environment can get uncomfortable when it's warm outside. It's possible that this place has no temperature control. But hey, there's free WiFi!
author: Sunder I.

description:
Stopped by to grab a cold brew and get some work done the other day - the coffee was really good, but also kind of pricey (~$5.25 for a 16oz draft cold brew).  The environment was really nice for getting work done, and the wifi was pretty reliable.  There seemed to be sufficient seating for everyone, as there was always a seat available when I was there on a weekday afternoon.  The staff were welcoming and friendly, and the place was very clean and modern.

Overall, this is a great cafe to stop by in a really convenient location downtown.
author: Tim L.

description: Small cafe in an industrial setting. Main draw is a sage and rosemary latte, though for an additional fee, you can add the syrup to any drink. I tried the S&R latte, expecting it to be an epicurean gimmick, but I underestimated San Francisco's coffee makers: it was excellent. Minus 2 stars for the small space and hard to reach outlets. I suppose one can always order coffee to go. (April 2018)
author: Matt R.

description:
Your average coffee shop. Nothing special, nothing particularly bad. 

If you need an outlet, they're only available along the bottom wall of the window-side bar seats. It gets busy around lunchtime, so come early to snatch a good seat.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Located a ways from all the hustle and bustle of Union Square and Westfield SF Shopping Center, Contraband Coffee Bar is like an oasis.  Lots of seating a space doesn't make you feel so cramped.  Tried their Nitro Cold Brew, which was very refreshing and strong.  Also recommend their Golden Pirate if you like green tea.  

Overall:  Great coffee spot away from all the SF tourism craziness
author: Joe G.

description: High ceilings, very airy. Side street has ample parking. Coffee is delicious! Friendly baristas. Great atmosphere to get some work done. Will be back!
author: Janet W.

description: Really neat speciality drinks and they have nice pastries. I went during the morning and it was understaffed with one person. I got one of the breakfast pies that had to be reheated twice (eggy and cold in the middle). I really liked my tumeric drink! Would definitely go to pick up a speciality drink that's outside of your americano / coffee morn. Might go for a pastry instead of a pie next time.
author: Teila E.

description:
My friend and I decided to catch over coffee in SoMa, and after some research, decided to check out Contraband. It's not terribly far from the metro, and is probably about a 5-10 min walk from Powell station depending on how fast you walk. The interior is extremely cute! There is a table seating for folks to do walk, booth seating to do some people watching, and tables for friends to catch up. It definitely would be a great place to get some work done for those who are looking for a work cafe, and there is WiFi! 

They roast and source their own beans so I was excited to try it out. There are the usual drinks like cappuccinos and lattes, and they also make other drinks that are more common in Europe like flat whites and dark whites! And there is a great selection of pour over coffee choices as well. There are also teas and other specialty drinks for those who don't drink coffee. My friend ordered the chai latte, and I ordered a flat white. I tried her chai latte and was pleasantly surprised..it wasn't overly sweet, which is just the way I liked it. I enjoyed my flat white as well. Can't say it would be one of my favorite espressos I've tried, but was still really good! We also split their hawaiian mochi muffin. It was quite interesting..the hawaiian mochi muffin makes an interesting mix and was quite yummy as well. There are other baked goods from Neighbor Bakehouse as well, which all looked amazing :) If I'm back in the neighborhood will def drop by to do some work and have a cup of coffee again!
author: Jackie C.

description:
I happened to come across Contraband Coffee Bar by chance. I was actually in the vicinity to try Elite Coffee but it was closed because of which I ended up here. And i'm glad I did!
I loved the vibe of this place - it had a very contemporary feel to it! The baristas were very polite and friendly. Also, it wasn't too crowded for a late Friday afternoon. 

I got a CAPPUCCINO and the POTATO TURNOVER - both of them were pretty good. Although I would've preferred the Turnover to be a little less oily. The Cappuccino was on point!

Good music + great vibe + pocket friendly + perfect coffee = Winner
author: Ishani S.

description:
I just had the best flat white I've had since Ristr8o in Chiang Mai, Thailand, which has won all kinds of international awards.

They also have a couple of the other oddball espresso drinks that I saw on the Rist8o menu.

They do not have the freshly-made waffles, but they do have savory "everything" croissants and other delights
author: Seth G.

description:
Usually great but the two people working the Friday Sept 7 morning shift were ridiculously slow, unapologetic for poor service, and very sarcastic. I always order Ethiopia Guji grade so know exactly how it should taste. They left my coffee in a pot after it was finished and I waited another 10 min before I asked for it to be poured.  I was given the wrong coffee but needed to go so I didn't correct them and left; it tasted too sour to be the roast I ordered.

The girl working there said "YOU should understand the wait is because we are short a person" in the most rude and sarcastic tone. All because I pointed out that my drink had been sitting / unpoured for a while. Also, it was not a busy Friday, nor did they look like they were short people. I've been here when there's only one person on shift and those baristas have been quick, attentive and polite. Will avoid the shop when I see those two working.
author: Jessica L.

description: Does a flat white which you're not always able to find in SF. They did a relatively decent job at it as well. The location is nothing to write home about but sat outside watching homeless people do their thing. So nothing different from any other spot in SF.
author: Dan N.

description: I absolutely love Contraband, and drop by often on weekends to do some reading or work. It's airy, bright, and clean, and I haven't had trouble finding desk space yet. There are also tall tables, which are awesome to work at if you need a break from sitting down. WiFi is very reliable which is always a plus. I highly recommend their teas and their mochi muffins!
author: Jiayi Z.

description: Came here because it was a convenient location! Tried the sage and Rosemary latte, and it's probably one of my favorite flavored lattes I've ever had. Not overly sweet, and topped with thick and creamy froth! And of course, it had the super cute design on top. The mug it was served in made me want to stay and get another. Interior was decorated nice and modern. Would definitely come back! Only one star off for the less than enthusiastic person taking my order and for the latte not being super hot (but some people like their coffee at different temps, so that's a minor thing to me )
author: Amanda M.

description:
Cool trendy neighborhood coffee place.  

Lots of options for brew style.
Small little sitting area

College kid like service

Food items limited
author: Jodi M.

description:
The place itself puts me back in Westwood.  There are a bunch of people working and studying there throughout the day. It's a very cool spot to spend time with people and have wifi to work throughout the day.  It kicks you off after a couple hours but you can get right back on so it's nothing more than a minor inconvenience.  I also had a meeting with my real estate agent here recently so I had a cup of tea.

I absolutely love this place.  I am not much of a coffee drinker, but the breakfast foods that they have are really great.

Back to the breakfast foods, though...the variety that they have is really great because not all people want sweet or savory.  I've had everything from a Curried Potato Turnover to a Loaded Croissant (onion croissant stuffed with cream cheese) to Cuban Guava and Cheese turnovers much like they have in Porto's in Los Angeles.

If you want to grab a quick bite in the morning this is a really cool place to come.  Everything I have tried here is delicious and the convenience of its location will keep me coming back.
author: Nick D.

description: I was looking for a local coffee place that has a signature menu and found this place!  I tried their sage & rosemary latte. It was amazing - perfect amount of sweetness and great rosemary flavor! My bf got a cold brew and liked it as well. If I lived here I would come here all the time! Too bad we don't have this place in Chicago.
author: Amy L.

description:
Stopped by Contraband Coffee bar on my last day of a work trip to San Fransisco so I could get some work done before my flight. The ambiance is nice. There's high wrap around tables with plenty of outlets for you to pop open your laptop and get to typing away. Since the tables wrap around the floor to ceiling windows, you get a look at the outside which is a nice view while you work. They've also got free WIFI, which was of course one of the things I look for in a coffee shop. 

I ordered a cold brew coffee which was a little bitter and pricey for my taste. The menu of more elaborate drinks did look interesting, tho.

For being so chilly outside, the coffee bar was pretty hot. Made it a bit uncomfortable for this girl to work in there. However, no one else seemed to mind as this place was packed on a Thursday afternoon!
author: Diandra L.

description: Smug baristas, overpriced, not worth it! My chai was lukewarm and bland @ $6.50 for a 160z!Starbucks is friendly at least!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This Contrabrand store is a great coffee shop! It offers free WiFi so you can come in, grab a drink and get to work. I actually came here to do some studying and work and it is now one of my favorite study spots. The noise level is average and not disruptive. The drinks this shop offers is decent tasting and good quality. Their drinks are a little pricey than other places but I think it has to do with the type of beans they use and it being in SoMa. However, I did wish they had vanilla syrup to offer in their drinks. 

The shop inside is very clean! It has a lot of natural lighting and the tables are very nice. I didn't use the restroom here but I would assume it is clean as well. 

I didn't take any photos of my drink but next time I go here I will and post it on yelp!
author: Angelina G.

description:
After going to another coffee shop nearby that didn't have outlets or wifi, I was ecstatic when I found this place. They have WIFI and OUTLETS! This was a wonderful find, and I just wanted to reiterate this.

I can't comment too much about the coffee here; I found it pretty good/normal. But let me speak about the amount of seating here. They have seating and tables by the windows, which makes me feel so much happier when I have to get work done and I can actually see the sun outside. I found this to be a nice place to sit down, but it also is a bit noisy and may not be the best place to have a conversation or take a phone call.
author: Julie L.

description:
On my last day in SF, two of my colleagues and I came here to get some mid-day work done. We hopped on the Yelp app and found that this place was close to where we were, so we easily walked over. This place seems to be popular because from the minute we walked in it was busy. 

Contraband has very minimalistic decor - white walls and wooden tables. I ordered a cold brew coffee w/ vanilla and one of their veggie empanadas and one of their spinach + feta empanadas. I was much more of a fan of their spinach + feta. When I went up to order the lady taking my order didn't seem like the happiest person, which kind of made for a bit of an awkward conversation. 

Bonus points for free fast wi-fi and plenty of outlets, so that we were easily able to do some work. Good spot to come in if you need to get some work done, grab a quick coffee, or meet with some friends.
author: Issabelle F.

description:
Much needed in this neighborhood.  The space is beautiful with high ceilings, custom wood tables, and natural lighting.  However, I hesitate to return until the training kinks are smoothed out.  

Yesterday, I tried the rosemary sage latte, which was the first savory latte I've ever had.  The spinach feta empanada was pretty decent, but it was very cold when first heated.  The barista did not know how to heat up this empanada correctly, nor did she get the proper training to operate the cash register.  No receipt for a credit card charge when asked.  Eek, secondhand embarrassment, and pretty uncomfortable for me due to the defensive 'tude.   

I have no doubt that the volume of customers will give the staff plenty of experience to perform  better.  Sure, I'd be willing to try Contraband in Nob Hill.  But in the meantime, there's always Philz, Elite, Sightglass, and Peets in Soma.
author: Miran C.

description: Staying one night in San Francisco and found this great coffee shop on yelp.  Boy are we glad we came here. The place is so cool. Love the story about the tables coming from a dead redwood. I had the sage and rosemary latte and it was great. Very creamy and one of the best lattes I've had in a while. My wife had a soy latte and she claims it's smooth and delicious.
author: Mark H.

description:
Horrible attitude! The brista (black girl with cornrows) did not smile, did not greed customers, and did not even talk! Her attitude was so bad that I was scared to make an order. She poured my coffee like pouring freaking bathtub water, it spilled EVERYFUCKINGWHERE, but she didn't give a shit. 
There's no air flow in the shop, it feels like freaking Arizona dessert. Do not go there unless you want to spend $6 per coffee and gets treat like shit!
author: Ella W.

description: Omg rosemary lavender latte! Best coffee I have had in a long time! This is such a great coffee bar. Staff is welcome and knowledgeable. Prices are right for the quality of coffee. Coffee bar is modern and clean.
author: Jesse B.

description: Great pastries and coffee! The pistachio croissant was unfairly good. I still think about it often and I wish I knew where to find one on the East Coast!!!
author: Bernadette K.

description: I really love the mochi muffins and the sage and rosemary latte here. Sounds like a strange flavor but the herbs go really well! They are definitely worth the somewhat high price. The area outside is not the worst, but not the best. This place is definitely worth the trek over.
author: Diane H.

description:
Great location for this small coffeeshop.

Cozy, sleek, modern, eco-friendly and kind of hipster interior. 

Unique selection of coffees and teas. They have 1,2 (brace yourself),...9 different drip coffees and 10 different teas. 

Consequently, I have yet to discover 95% of their menu but had fun trying out these:
- Chai Tea: They have 3 different Chai Teas. I tasted the Bhakti and it was yummy. Worth a taste!
- Dark White: A flat white with akinosie chocolate. If you do not like dark chocolate, I would avoid this but since I love all chocolate this was a winner imo.
- Latte: All good.
- Hot chocolate: Will hit the spot but is nothing special.
- Breakfast burrito: pretty yummy but small for the price you pay.
- Coconut Chocolate Chip Cookie: Nom nom nom, get it!

Staff is happy to answer any questions, but do not expect any warm and fuzzy chit chat.
author: Ellen H.

description:
Good coffee, and the barista was friendly and knowledgeable.  I described the type of coffee I like (not too bitter or bold), and she selected a pour-over brew for me that I really liked.  The free wi-fi was also pretty speedy, clocking in at 13.63 Mbps download and .72 Mbps upload.  However, something about the place was off-putting.  There was no music or charming touches, and it just lacked character.  If I go to a coffee shop to work, I don't want it to feel like an office.  I want some cozy touches.  I notice some other reviewers have described the atmosphere as "contemporary," so it really depends what you're looking for.

Also, I wouldn't bother with food here.  I ordered a broccoli cheese quiche and the flavor was fine, but it wasn't heated through enough to be enjoyable.  

I would return to Contraband if convenient, but just wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Sheri W.

description: the sage and rosemary latte is unique, try it! A little on the pricy side at $5.00 for a 12 oz. a great place to study, with plenty of outlets, natural lighting, and free wifi.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Very cozy and well lit spot nestled between two housing complexes on 5th street in close proximity or about half a block from the Dugoni Dental and University of the Pacific Graduate School. Its also half a block from the Audio Coffee Bar too.  

F O O D  &  D R I N K
Illicit espresso. 
      One of the strongest tasting espressos I've had in this part of town, yet unfortunately it wasn't the most caffeinated. 

Pistachio Croissant.
   Aesthetically appealing but not the greatest tasting. All I got was a powdered flurry of confectioners sugar and an overly sweet sponge of more sugar. Quite soggy and not appetizing after that. Oh yeah, WHERE'S THE PISTACHIO BTW?

O V E R A L L:
I'd definitely come back to try the other interesting sounding coffees and espressos, though I'll pass on the pastries. After this experience, I think I'll go elsewhere with my sweet tooth.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
The wifi kicks you off every 2 hours.

Has many of the same great staff as the original location and makes the same great drinks but unlike the one on Larkin there is no loyalty program and the wifi kicks you off every 2 hours.

I can't understate how much of a pain the wifi is. The old location kicks you off after 24 hours. With 2 hours there's a good chance I can be kicked off of the internet during an interview / business call which is unacceptable. Will probably start frequenting another cafe because of this.
author: Desmond W.

description: It's a good place to use a laptop, or read a book. There's quite, and not too crowded. Beverages are fine. Staffs are not so friendly, but it's downtown San Francisco. I mean so normal. One bonus point, their WiFi is okay level.
author: Yumiko H.

description: I could've sworn I had given this place a review before!! I'm quite the regular here. Their hot chocolate is amazing!!! I get it all the time. My usual drink is a soy chai latte, but they always seem to be out of soy milk. :/ I did get the chance to try it once, but the chai spices overcame the sweet soy...so I'll stick to hot chocolate :) I come here at least 3/5 days for my lunch break. They have free wifi, good music, awesome staff, and plenty of seating.
author: Tilly D.

description: I frequent Contraband 2-3 times a week. The coffee is delicious, but at the end of the day, I come here for the staff. Always friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. One baristo is particularly generous with jokes and compliments... It keeps me coming back despite other coffee options nearby. (Well done, Contraband team!)
author: Stephanie K.

description: Great coffee; great wifi & atmosphere with tables around the perimeter windows, so you can work and gaze out into the street (for me helps me eyes after starting at a computer screen for hours). Be prepared to pay $6 for a large coffee though! It's worth it for the amenities.
author: David F.

description: Popped in here for a pour over coffee. Ordered the dark roast 12 oz. $4.25 later, the coffee was actually NOT good, and service came with a frown. It's okay to smile people!
author: craig l.

description: Not a huge fan of their coffee, but their pastries are so so good! I ordered the pistachio croissant and it was life changing. There was some sort of cookie crumble on top of the pastry and inside was an amazing jam filling. I would go back for this pastry alone! I'm not even a pistachio fan and I'm still drooling about it!
author: Anh Thu P.

description: Nice coffee shop with a wide selection of artisanal pourovers. They have a number of large tables and barstools around the outside perimeter, but not too many small tables for two.
author: Geoff N.

description:
It's okay. I was going to give it a 4, but I think it's just okay. The staff was friendly-ish. No one smiled and he had a little attitude this morning, maybe just a bad day but I don't know. The drink is good, the food was decent. What was nice was that it was relatively quick to get the drinks and food. 

Tip: be careful of the step at the entrance door, there's a sign, but people definitely have tripped there, so that's a little design flaw.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Rude barista (Asian with a nose ring) in the morning today. Was very short with me and not welcoming. Only smiles to men (white men) I've noticed the times I've been in there. She does not go in chronological order therefore I was late this morning. I refuse to go to this location if she's working!  

I must say, the coffee is good but wished they offered banana bread and better service than I received today~ disappointed contraband!
author: Breya D.

description:
Made a short trek here from Westfield on a Saturday afternoon and it was pleasantly empty, minus a few people doing work. The decor is indeed minimalist in a somewhat sterile, trying-to-appeal-to-millenials way, but as a recent college grad who spent weekends jumping from coffee shop to coffee shop looking for a place that had both seating and wifi, this is awesome. 

The sage and rosemary latte was right up my alley, not too sweet and just the right amount of herbal flavor. A small size did set me back $5.50, but I think I'm just going to have to accept that that's the going rate for a specialty latte in the city.
author: Amy J.

description: Newest coffee shop near me so of course it deserves my visit!! Atmosphere is hipster, white decor and wood. They have an extensive menu of types of coffee and food as well-- more like pastries, both savory and sweet. They have this baked mochi muffin that looks like a dry ass bran muffin. I was pleasantly surprised that it's slightly crunch on the outside and inside is a chewy mochi texture. I love it! I've only ordered their cortado--Cuban coffee with milk. It's a shot and it's strong and bitter. Gets me in that caffeine high which I love! They have seating among these beautifully crafted wooden logs so you can sit for coffee time.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Rad coffee shop close to everything that you need to get to. Stayed at an Air B&B across the street and came back to this spot Back to Back like Drake's diss track. 
Being in DTLA has made me a bit of a coffee snob so they had plenty of options so you could sip slow with the pinky out or drown your sleepless nights with delicious coffee. I tend to get my coffee cold and black like my soul so this place was perfect. I got a quad shot americano that jolted me wide awake like putting a fork in the wall socket...but without the death or electrocution. I was knee deep in emails, but knocked them out like I was Mike Tyson in his prime.
Not many options for food, but the pastries were really good. Day one I got a mochi/buckwheat/rum muffin. Everything was good except for the name. The should just call it the hipster muffin, all the good without the bad. Day two I got the Guava Turnover... and man, I don't know who turned it over but it was delicious. Every bite felt like this turnover was whispering sweet nothings to my tastebuds which made each bite emotional. Each bite was amazing, but also each bite meant it was closer to the end. Highly recommend this spot.
author: Jose G.

description:
Mediocre service & hard pastries? Hmm..

Came here on a Monday morning & ordered an iced coffee from a dismal looking server who seemed to hate her job. 1st star dock. 

Ordered a matcha scone & it was hard, tasteless, & stale. 2nd star dock. 

It took 10 minutes for my iced Americano to come out. This might be one of the easiest drinks to make, considering it requires no milk/syrup/flavors.. 3rd star dock. 

I won't be returning. Better luck next time! :/
author: Rachel Y.

description: Overpriced, but what coffee shop isn't in this area of town. I got some type of matcha latte, and it was incredible.
author: Mary K.

description: Today I was just a simple out of towner walking from the San Fran station to the bookbinders museum for an event. My 15 minute journey was arduous as I had to maneuver through feces, piles of used syringes & what I can only describe as "prescribed cannabis burnings". As I came nearer to my destination I found contraband coffee to be a safe haven and respite from the depravity of 5th st. I'm glad to report I did not see any latex gloves on the floor or empty liquor bottles...however what was on the floor were the power outlets to charge my phone. If I were a male, I doubt the young lady sitting next to me would have appreciated my "familiarity" as I was attempting to charge my phone. On that note, unless your cord is at minimum 1 meter be prepared to crawl and place your phone on a dusty/dirty void under a wonderfully crafted table as you enjoy delicious, meticulously made (took some time to get), smooth cup of coffee.
author: Imanah G.

description: The flat white was tiny - came in a double shot glass which was strange. It was good though. Just unexpected. Their breakfast pies were great though - I got a veggie one because they were out of sausage. It was surprisingly good. Then I also got a breakfast taco with bacon and that was delicious. 4 stars only because they're pretty pricy - I think it wound up being $16 for all that. But they were very friendly and the food was good.
author: Sarah I.

description: Really like this place but there's way too much ice in the ice coffee, and they'll make you pay more if you want more coffee and less ice. Otherwise great. But the ice thing is a problem. If you're into coffee and not ice.
author: Alex K.

description: As soon as I entered, I was greeted by the sweetest workers here. They had this genuinely friendly and caring vibe going on around them, and I appreciated that. I ordered the Rosemary Sage Latte because well, HOW COULD I NOT?!?! House made rosemary and sage syrup added into their drinks?! Guuuh, I had to. It was either that or the Pirates which was a Spicy Matcha drink. The Rosemary Sage Latte was deeeelish! Love it! That hint of rosemary and sage wasn't overbearing and added just the nicest amount of remaining flavor as you sigh after taking a sip of your hot latte. Next time, I'm looking forward to trying it iced though! These types of drinks taste unique hot and iced. There's wifi here which is great! The hightop tables have these nifty little hooks underneath to hold your bags or jackets. And they've got these pretty flowers in pretty vases all around the place. The flowers in the middle table were my favorite setup. Anyways, I very much enjoyed this coffee shop from their service, to their unique drinks, to their decor. I can't wait to come back!
author: Kim N.

description:
There are two things that I look for in a coffee shop: 1) Coffee (duh) and 2) WiFi. 

The iced latte I got was alright (a little overpriced). The WiFi didn't work, unfortunately. The baristas were friendly and they had some nice loud alternative rock music. The lighting is great for reading, but I would not recommend if you want to get laptop work done.
author: Steven Z.

description: The driest scone I have ever had was the matcha scone here. Maybe I should have gone for the pistachio croissant. When I asked the barista on his thoughts on the pastry selection he curtly stated he doesn't eat sweets. Needless to say, the "service" was not top notch.
author: S W.

description:
Stumbled upon this place running late to a company meeting and thought "...what the heck?! I'm already late." Not sure if it was the store front, the decor or amount of customers inside or the long line that lured me in but I'm glad I'm here. I'm not a coffee drinker so I scanned the menu really quickly. Didn't want to be holding up the line so I ordered an orange juice and a waffle. They have the lightly sweetened waffles
like Jamba Juice, yum! As I stood at the counter waiting for my order I noticed the beakers they have the coffee dispensed in after brewing. How freaking cute is that?! I told myself next time I'll try the hot chocolate and chocolate croissant. It looked delicious.
author: Itika D.

description: This place has great coffee. I love the spicy aspect of the mocha.  Also, they do not make their drinks over sweet like a lot of places. Their pour over coffee is really good too. Convenient location in SoMa and a small pretty seating arrangement inside.
author: Krystal R.

description: Excellent decor and aesthetics to this cafe. My coffee was dripped slowly and the pistachio croissant was flaky and divine. I don't know much about the cafe/coffee scene in San Francisco but this place hit all the right notes for me. Also another place an aspiring social media starlet would want to check out.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Premium pour-over  coffee, artisan pastries but slow and Blue Bottle-esque  douchiness considering the south of market homeless crack-location where most patrons are passing by on, or away from their work commute.
Serving premium brewed coffee as well might be a good option for those that just want coffee to go and don't have 20 minutes to wait.
author: Joshua D.

description: I saw it opening recently and close to my house which is very nice! I bring my friend to come here and give it a try, we order two Chai tea latte without ice, but!!! We just got half cup of chai tea latte?!?! Really? Excuse me? Half cup? But I paid full price! Unbelievable...
author: Faye L.

description:
Tall ceilings, lots of light, and friendly baristas!

There's a counter top table area by the windows which is great for people watching or for if you want even more natural light. 

The place was clean, I had a great latte, and overall enjoyed spending a few hours here getting work done.
author: Justin G.

description: Good coffee and wonderful lighting. I think they could do more business with better food offerings and especially, better service. It's a small space so there's no excuse for baristas to just leave a customer's drink cooling on the counter without calling the customer's name or just walking the drink over. It's happened more than once to me and other customers I've seen. For me, it's just one barista in particular. Starbucks baristas have a better sense of customer service.
author: Ichor B.

description: I stopped by one Saturday afternoon and really needed my coffee fix. I ordered the single origin espresso with the sparkling water. Whoa....that is some bold espresso. I never had a shot packed with so much fire. It's thick and coats your whole mouth almost like it had alcohol. After downing it, the sparkling water cuts through strong flavors and cleanse the mouth. This won't be the last time I visit.
author: Kien M.

description: I've heard about this place but I've never been so I decided to try it out. Disappointment. I got a pour over that was burnt and stale. It was also over brewed. It tastes like the drip coffee from any random Starbucks. It smelled burnt but I decided to give it a chance anyway. I took a couple sips and I couldn't do it. I ended up giving it to the bf who drinks the coffee flavored sugar most people drink. Would not recommend unless you don't mind bad coffee.
author: Grace C.

description: A great minimalist spot in a quiet SOMA space with a cornucopia of coffees and a few snacks to choose from, top-notch baristas, and top-of-the-line equipment. My favorite option was getting an illicit espresso with sparkling water. The bubbles of the water really bring out the more subtle espresso flavors. I haven't tried this combination before Contraband, but now it's how I roll every time I pull one at home!
author: Max G.

description: Steps away from the Intercontinental, so very convenient for both my morning and afternoon coffee runs while traveling, and much quieter than the nearby Blue Bottle. Got hooked on the flat white with almond milk. Would return again, but only if I'm in the area.
author: Laura M.

description: Some of the best Cortados in San Francisco. The service is quick and this is one of my go to places for good coffee in the city
author: Arun D.

description:
I live across the street from this location, so was pretty excited to hear it was opening, having heard good things about the original location.

I've been going semi-regularly since it opened and so far, the coffee and the service are yet to disappoint.

A welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Abid D.

description:
Cute modern coffee shop, but their almond milk latte was disgusting. No idea what was in it, in hindsight I should have just sent it back. 

You can do better than this in this part of town.
author: S B.

description: Wow! I'm from Sac but in SF on Tuesdays with some time to kill and I ALWAYS come here now. Great vibe and amazing coffee, particularly the house made rosemary and sage latte. The barista is super friendly and knowledgeable about her coffee! She makes great recommendations. I'll keep coming here for sure!
author: Matthew G.

description: Contraband coffee is on my way to work so finally I stopped one day when I got off. The place seemed chill, good spot to just lap top it up with your headphones on. Theres plenty of seating and the girl working made me feel like I was her buggy. She was like "whats up!?"... I enjoy quirkiness. As for the coffee itself, It was good I got an iced sage coffee of some sort. Couldn't really taste the "infused" flavors but that didn't bother me. If your looking for a $6 iced coffee here is your place. Next time I plan to try one of them fancy pants waffles that I eyeballed when I was there. P.s. I like their cool Contraband Sign out front!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Amazing coffee!

Loved the interior of this place, I spent an hour here a few days ago reading the newspaper and taking in the vibe. But the reason it's getting 5 stars is definitely due to their incredible coffee. I started with a latte, which was delicious and ended up getting another one for the road.  Definitely check out their chocolate croissants!
author: Jon N.

description: The sage and rosemary latte was absolutely delicious - it's worth a visit for this unique drink. It was pretty loud when we went in and there wasn't a ton of seating so it's not a sit and stay, cozy kind of place for me. Appreciated the local products for sale and local art decorating the walls.
author: Christine C.

description: Great tasting coffee, friendly staff, and a good location. Drinks are a bit overpriced but that's normal for San Francisco. My only major complaint is the music is often playing way too loud so it can be a little distracting if you're trying to get work done...
author: Gordon Z.

description: So I am a very sensitive cafe-goer. But I did not like how echo-chambery the high stone walls + music blasting + subsequent loud conversations made the place feel. Do you really have to blast Explosions in the Sky so that no one can hear themselves talk?
author: Michelle C.

description: Free Wifi, loads of outlets and good coffee -- all I need for a couple of productive hours. An added bonus is the likelihood of finding street parking! There is that coffee smell in here so expect to smell like roasted beans when you leave. I ordered the potato curry pastry which was delicious. A bit on the oily side, but the server heated it up and it was thoroughly enjoyable. I'm a bit adventurous when it comes to drinks and I ordered the sage rosemary iced latte and let's just say I will not be getting it again.
author: Shruti S.

description: Kudos to a private coffee bar for being open early - 6 am!  I tried Contraband this morning and am impressed.  The barista was friendly and helpful, the pastries looked delicious (didn't try because I was on a coffee mission), and my latte was excellent.  My latte tasted better than the latte I got from Blue Bottle a couple of days ago. Pricing is consistent with other similar places - $4.25 for a 12 oz latte.  I was also intrigued by their coffee menu - loved the descriptions - so I'll have to try one of those next time I'm in the area. The interior of the shop was clean and modern, with lots of places to sit.  Of course, it was just past 6 am so there weren't too many other people in there yet. I agree with the tip to be careful of the entrance step, but they do have a sign outside the door warning patrons.
author: Sarah M.

description: This place is a GREAT place to get some light work done or just meet up for coffee. AMAZING coffee and great atmosphere.  The WIFI is not the fastest, but gets the job done.  I would buy their beans and work here again.
author: Victor H.

description: Great coffee - love the au lait. Watch your step on the way in! Industrial chic surroundings that still feel comfortable. The baristas are helpful and nice - great way to start or extend the day.
author: Dave B.

description: I love this place. I had one of the best lattes in town. Their matcha latte was excellent as well. Nathan (one of the owners) is such a cool, cool guy.
author: J.J. P.

description: Free WiFi, power outlets, modern design, great coffee, and friendly staff. Awesome new place!
author: Yury L.

description: Great first impression. Barista was friendly and welcoming. The matcha chai was also delicious!
author: Ashley S.

description:
I used to frequent the other Contraband location several times a week when I lived in Nob Hill.  Easily some of the best espresso in the City, and a fun variety of single origins to chose from.  I still go back whenever I'm close by.  I was stoked they opened a cafe near my office!  I came in the first week and they clearly had some organizational issues to deal with.  But things seem to flow much better now, and I've had some espresso at this location that was even better than what I remember having at their other spot.  The staff, in general, is very friendly. Their pastries are always outstanding, but sometimes sold out.  Once they gave me a cold empenada, but I told them, and they made me a hot one.  Problem solved.  My girlfriend ordered an "iced separator" the other day when it was hot out, and wow was that thing good.  I read some of the other reviews.  Who are these dummies?  What kind of a person calls a business in San Francisco to ask if parking is difficult?  This is SAN FRANCISCO.  Parking sucks here.  Driving sucks here.  Parking at their other location is nearly impossible some days.  This location actually has lots of parking every time I go.  Metered and hourly.

Bottom line is that if you like amazing coffee from nice people in a beautiful space, Contraband is worth checking out!  Watch your step!
author: D N.

description: Unimpressed. The space is beautiful and wherever they get the chocolate croissant from is delicious. But the actual drinks were less than subpar. The chai latte was the worst. Americano is underwhelming. Drip coffee is decent but nothing to rave about.
author: Jessie S.

description: Awesome place to get a little reading done and sip on some golden chai! Tasty snacks, too.
author: Anna K.

description: Overall not great, but it is the closest cafe to my place. The coffee and tea is okay for sf standards but not great.  It's very clean and sterile with beautiful wood tables and a very young hipster staff.  I guess I'll just keep on walking.
author: Andre G.

description: Cute place! Very clean, friendly staff, and amazing espresso. The iced separator was hands down one of the best coffee drinks I've ever ordered. Perfect balance of salty and not too sweet ^_^
author: Katerina E.

description:
Some of the best coffee in town. Beautiful new location. The wood counter tops are gorgeous .

The Barista was on point. Super friendly and  awesome attitude. My latte couldn't have been better. Theyre slayer espresso machine is pretty cool. While the espresso is hard to beat. 

They didnt have any prepackaged beans... but the barista was more than happy to bag me some fresh ones. All while sharing knowledge on different roasts. I felt very comfortable and was happy with his knowledge. I can only imagine this place will get better.
author: Cody C.

description: Review is for the unfriendly staff. I called in twice and took about 10 calls total to get through. I asked a simple question about parking and spoke with two different people. They both had really bad attitudes and said "I don't know what do you want me to tell you there's street parking." I asked do I have to pay? Is it every two hours? Is it difficult to park? It's fine if you don't know, but at least try to find the answer or ask someone who may know. That's basic customer service skills. They gave me attitude as if I was being a huge bother for calling in.
author: Florence K.

description:
We stopped in contraband today and found out this location had only been open about a week, but it was so well put together & the presentation of the space was elegantly comfortable.
Michael & Amber were super sweet & knowledgeable & helpful. 
Funny though, even with being in a coffee shop, we got a hot cocoa & a chai. Needless to say, the cocoa was rich & dark & the chai was amazing. Definitely try the Bhakti chai for a more traditional type...super smooth & a nice bite of ginger. 
Next time we go back we'll actually have to get some coffee!
author: Saul L.

description: Extremely friendly staff. Very helpful barista that helped me figure out which coffee I would like. Being from out of town I would suggest this as a unique trendy coffee place. I would go again for sure.
author: Russell O.

description: Such a nice cafe. Tangie ( i am sure i got that wrong) made a super tasty Latte and was the kind of person who would make me want to come back to a business with how accommodating she was. Temp was nice on the drink not too hot or cold and i did not feel the need to add sugar. Super place to grab a cup. Will come back here every chance i get. Silly me used to just walk right by this place. Always wanted to try it but never had and glad i did!
author: Erik L.

description: Since they opened up awhile ago, I've been going a couple times a week usually. My co-workers and I have been happy for the addition to the neighborhood. Mandy and crew are always nice. I'm a fan of the chai and pastries, too.  :)
author: Shamilla J.

description: Love the coffee and snacks. Was a big fan of the Larkin spot and this one is just as good. Great location and layout. Service is always courteous and prompt. If you love great coffee this is the place to go.
author: Ed B.

description: A regular weekly stop during my work week. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, delicious coffee and the line is never that long. Dog friendly as well as long as they're on leash which is great.
author: Catherine T.

description: Stopped in for a coffee to go at 11 a.m. today. The barista was friendly and had me on my way with coffee in hand within minutes. The fresh ground, fresh brewed coffee was amazing!
author: Michael M.

description: Super tasty.   They know good coffee and the snacks are great too.  I could tell this place cares about the quality of food and drink a lot.  They have a range of options and all have been good every time I try something.
author: Ryan F.

description: The coffee here is fantastic. Had it over at their Larkin location but am really happy they opened here.
author: Adam T.

description: Stopped in about a week after it opened and had a cortado. The espresso was very good, I liked it a bit more than Blue Bottle, almost as much as Ritual. The space was really nice with all of the wood slab furniture. Hope to come back when the weather warms up and take advantage of the outside seats at the nice corner location.
author: Phillip S.
